name: burnished
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
smooth and shiny, usually because of being polished (= rubbed): The case is burnished aluminium. burnished mahogany doors
(of a colour) shining in a warm way: Their children have burnished olive skin.
having had improvements made to it: Nothing in political prose has been so burnished as his acceptance speech.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sculpture is a giant piece of burnished metal.eye shadow in burnished bronzeHer hair is closely cropped, and burnished orange.His behaviour clashes with his burnished image as a defender of traditional values.
